column1: This pulling and twisting blocks blood flow to the testicle.
To perform the procedure: - The surgeon will make a cut in your scrotum to get to the twisted cord.
Surgery is needed right away in most cases to relieve pain and swelling and to prevent the loss of the testicle.
Risks of this surgery are: - Bleeding - Infection - Pain - Wasting away of the testicle despite the return of blood flow
Pain medicine, rest, and ice packs will relieve pain and swelling after surgery.
